Docs.summary: The reason for the (key-) signature revocation.
A reason text for the (key-) signature revocation.
The (key-) signatures that shall be revoked.

block.para: You need to specify an () array containing the numbers of all (key-) signatures that shall be revoked. If you enumerate the list of (key-) signatures ( property) to count and identify the correct numbers - make sure that you DON'T count "revocation" signatures/certificates. You can check this with the property for each (key-) signature in the list.

Example:
# gpg --edit-key 321FEDCBA Command > check uid Mallory <mallory@home.internal> rev! ABCDEF123 2009-08-01 Alice <alice@home.internal> rev! ABCDEF123 2009-08-02 Alice <alice@home.internal> sig!3 321FEDCBA 2009-08-01 [self-signature] sig! ABCDEF123 2009-08-01 Alice <alice@home.internal>
There are four entries in this example list of (key-) signatures. The first two are "revocation signatures". That means the self-signature starts with number "1" and Alice's (key-)signature follows with number "2". (In this example, Alice created two revocation signatures/certificates. She created the first one on August 1st and the second one on August 2nd.)

Docs.summary: The user ID from which (key-) signatures shall be revoked.
Docs.remarks: A PGP key can contain several identities (user IDs). The first Uid (=1) is the primary user ID.
